topic.title: About the Cloudberry Database Release Version Number
topic.shortdesc: Cloudberry Database version numbers and the way they change identify what has been modified from one Cloudberry Database release to the next.

body.p:
A Cloudberry Database release version number takes the format x.y.z, where:
x identifies the Major version number
y identifies the Minor version number
z identifies the Patch version number

Cloudberry Database releases that have the same Major release number are guaranteed to be backwards compatible. Cloudberry Database increments the Major release number when the catalog changes or when incompatible feature changes or new features are introduced. Previously deprecated functionality may be removed in a major release.

The Minor release number for a given Major release increments when backwards compatible new features are introduced or when a Cloudberry Database feature is deprecated. (Previously deprecated functionality will never be removed in a minor release.)
Cloudberry Database increments the Patch release number for a given Minor release for backwards-compatible bug fixes.
